github.copilot.chat.commitMessageGenerat.text:
Generate a concise, informative commit message using the Conventional Commit format: <type>(<Scope>): <subject>

<body>

<footer>
Types: 'feat', 'fix', 'test', 'docs', 'style', 'chore', 'perf', 'refactor', 'revert', 'ci', 'build', 'wip', 'release'. Use these to indicate the kind of change.
Scope: Specify the part of the codebase affected, starting with a capitalized letter (e.g., Api, Ui, Auth). Omit if the change is broad or system-wide.
Subject: Write a short, imperative mood description of the change (e.g., 'add ...', not 'added ...'). Keep it under 70 characters. Do not end with a period. Start with a lowercase letter.
Body: Provide more detailed explanatory text, if necessary. Wrap at 500 characters. Explain what and why, not how. Always use bullets for multiple points.
